reviewText: Very cool that I am the first 2 review this but let me get on with it.Now I did some research on this PPV and at the time it came out it had 11 matches.I get the tape and pop it in and there is half the PPV with only 5 matches. A PPV that was probably at least 3 hours at the time no becomes not even 2 hours, very annoying.The matches you get to see are good with Austin VS Rhodes and the 8 man horror cage match including: Vader/Diamond Studd aka Scott Hall/Abdullah the Butcher/Steiners/Sting/El Gigante AKA Giant Gonzalez and of course the legendary Mick Foley who does take a beating like always in this match. The main event was hot with Luger defending the world title againist Ron SImmons in a 2/3 falls match. Very good match and the only thing that saved me from complete agony in this stripped PPV. Overall a decent show with JR and Schiavone doing the play by play.Oh I almost foregot, Rude makes his WCW appearance as a very gay WCW phantom.Still he cuts a great promo w/ Paul Heyman. Overall worth it for the vintage memories just don't expect a loaded card.
summary: Great Event But why is it DIssected???
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well thanks again to "WWE Classics On Demand", I was able to relive another PPV from the past in WCW's Halloween Havoc '91.  However I also remember watching this show on VHS years ago and for those who don't already know, WCW used to heavily edit or just remove various matches from the PPV on the VHS tape to get it down to around the 2 hour mark...and in this case, they edited a 11 match card down to just 6 matches on the VHS...which really makes for some stupid moments like Jim Ross saying congrads to Brian Pillman for winning the Light Heavyweight Title tournament when you never saw the match.The majority of the matches removed were really just so awful that I'm sure nobody was upset just because they decided to exclude such "classics" as Big Josh & P.N. News vs. The Creatures (a masked gimmicked tag team just for this show), Bill Kazmaier vs. Oz (Kevin Nash back when he had to spray his hair grey instead of the natural look he has now), and Van Hammer squashing Doug Sommers complete with an entrance of construction workers using jackhammers.  However, the matches that were taken off the VHS that were quality in their own right like the "sleeper" match of the night in Terrance Taylor vs. Bobby Eaton and the finals of the WCW Light Heavyweight Tournament between Brian Pillman & Richard Morton...luckly the Pillman/Morton match was later released on Brian Pillman's "Loose Cannon" DVD set.The matches that were on this set are...Chamber Of Horrors Match: Sting, Steiner Brothers, El Gigante vs. Vader, Abdullah The Butcher, Diamond Studd (Scott Hall), Cactus Jack - This match used the Thunderdome cage structure which was WCW's version of the WWE's Hell In A Cell as far as it being a steel cage that not only cages in the ring but the outside area as well.  This was an 8 man brawl complete with caskets filled with masked mystery men, handcuffs, zombies carring a stretcher, referee Nick Patrick wearing a helmet with a camera attached to it called the "Refer-eye camera" so we can see what he's seeing, and an electric chair lowered from the ceiling with the way to win the match is that you have to stuff your opposition in the chair and then pull the switch.  This has gone on as one of the biggest "wrestlecrap" matches of all time strictly off just how corny all of this same off as.  The match itself isn't bad but you just can't help but either laugh or shake your head and some of the stuff to happen during this match...like how the switch fell into the on position so many times & yet the cameras zoomed in on it.  But the highlight of the match for me was Tony Schavonie's line at the end of the match when Abdullah opened his eyes after the match saying, "I guess when he opened his eyes, he thought he was in heaven and knew he shouldn't be there!"Johnny B. Badd vs. Jimmy Garvin - Michael Hayes was "injured" so Jimmy Jam took his place here in this match and was watchable but nothing special.WCW Television Champion Steve Austin vs. Dustin Rhodes - Long before we knew them as Goldust & "Stone Cold", these youngers wrestled here here their real names.  This was one of those matches that buildup over time & got better as it went along.  The TV Title matches usually were always based around the champion trying to last the time limit and this was no expection here but you saw the future potential both men had here.Tom Zenk vs. WCW Phantom - The Phantom was a man completely dressed in black with a mask over his head beating Tom Zenk in a quick squash match with the reverse neckbreaker.  However the bigger story here was that the Phantom was revealed to the suprise of everyone in the arena later in the night to be "Ravishing" Rick Rude having alligned himself with Paul E. Dangerously & Madusa to start the "Dangerous Alliance" stable...but keep in mind I said "everyone in the arena" because if you listened to the commentary during this match at the end then you hear Tony Schavonie give the idenity away by referring to the finishing move by it's more famous name...The Rude Awakening.WCW Tag Team Champions Enforcers vs. WCW Patriots - This was a "champions vs. champions" match since the Patriots were also the United States Tag Team Champions & for those who don't remember who the Patriots were, they were WCW's idea of a good guy tag team with one person being a fireman & the other being an army guy (a bad attempt at a Sgt. Slaughter type of character).  The Patriots were seriously green in the ring so the veterans of Arn Anderson & Larry Zbyszko carried this team to a decent match.2 Out Of 3 Falls Match: WCW Champion Lex Luger vs. Ron Simmons - With Luger already having Harley Race in his corner, Ron Simmons had Dusty Rhodes in his corner with Jim Ross (being the great commentator that his is) pointing out the history between both Race & Rhodes when it comes to being on opposite sides of World Championship matches.  They heavily built this to be Ron Simmons time as champion and it sure looked that way as he scored the first decision in 5 mins. with a spinebuster that every was real stiff or Luger was just great at selling because you saw his back really hurting during the rest of the match.  Eventhough Luger doesn't have the best reputation for being a worker, this is one of my favorite matches from him as it told a great story with Luger being thrown off right from the start & wrestling "defense" and trying to cheat his way to a victory and Simmons just kept bringing the fight to Luger.In the end, this tape only had two matches you could concider good (TV & World Title matches), one match that was just an entertaining trainwreck you just have to see to believe (Chamber Of Horrors), and the rest were just uneventful fillers.  Rhodes & Austin would go on to have similar & better matches available on better events while you can easily find the other two matches on YouTube so this is one event I suggest you pass on.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Last week I reviewed the headache causing Great American Bash 1991. 1 thing I forgot to mention is that cause of that PPV the buyrates went down WCW lost more money than usual that ended with Mike Graham telling Bischoff you need to hire Hulk Hogan a couple of years later. But back to my Halloween Havoc 91 review The Great American Bash was a cluster f  v  c  k by Jim Herd & Dusty Rhodes cause he deserves some of the blame too not just Jim Herd Dusty was the booker at this time. A booker is like the writer on a movie & I have reviewed a lot of movies on here & when a script isn't that great it hurts the movie. That's what a lot of these Pay Per Views in 1991 were like not a great script but the action & fight scenes are good meaning the wrestling. But some of the bad booking is what hurt these shows from getting a 9 or a 10 out of 10. WCW stuck in a rut at this point so Dusty did some long term booking which was good for a change. But is Halloween Havoc 91 any better than The Great American Bash 1991. Of course I'm going to tell the backstory to this show on The July 27th episode of World Championship Wrestling Ron Simmons made the challenge for The WCW World Heavyweight Championship he said that Barry Windham had his chance. Ron Simmons asked for weeks but was always confronted by Harley Race & Mr Hughes. At a House Show Ron Simmons was attacked by Race Hughes & Luger. Barry Windham cut a promo at this House Show as well he was still mad over what happend at the bash he was also laid out by Race Hughes & Luger. Barry Windham became a babyface. Ron Simmons came down & made the save they formed a partnership. In The Omni on August 25th Lugr retained The WCW World title when he defeated Ron Simmons when he hit The Attitiude Adjustment his version of the piledriver on a chair. Windham came down to tell The Referee what happend but he was attacked by Luger, Race & Hughes. At The Clash Of Champions 16 Ron Simmons wanted to talk to Luger cause he was tired of Luger hiding behind Harley Race & Mr Hughes. Luger was in his locker room getting ready to be interviewed by Missy Hyatt Simmons was kicked out by Lex Luger he then barged right in his locker room. So later on in The Clash they had The Contract Signing for Halloween Havoc Lex said after I beat you at Halloween Havoc I could use a driver maybe you could be my Schaffer which that set Ron Simmons off he went after Luger but Luger, Race & Hughes escaped in a limo. Then on The September 7th episode of World Championship Wrestling Luger sent a message to Ron Simmons he scrapped Barry Windham's face across some concrete on the outside. The following week it was the match was made a 2 out of 3 falls match. On The October 19th episode of World Championship Wrestling Ron Simmons was being interviewed by Jim Ross Simmons went through both their history in College Football till now. It was announced that Mr Hughes would be banned from ringside Simmons also said that he would have a manager in his corner it would be The American Dream Dusty Rhodes. On The August 17th episode of World Championship Wrestling Sting recieeved a gift box & it was a returning Abdullah The Buthcer who attacked Sting & he was being paid by someone to take him out of Professional Wrestling. Now since Lex Luger was World Champion he had to give up The US title Sting had won it in a 1 Night Round Robin Tournament at The August 25th Show in The Omni. So at The Clash Of Champions 16 he defended it against Johnny B Badd another gift box came down the ramp after Sting defeated Badd to retain the title Cactus Jack came out of it & made his return he attack Sting & gave him an elbow drop above the announcers table. Later on in the show Cactus Jack was being interviewed a gift box came for Cactus Jack he thought it was Abdullah The Butcher but it was Sting he returned the favor & attacked Cactus Jack. On The September 7th episode of World Championship Wrestling another gift box came for Sting & it was lady that had a note for Cactus Jack that said where ever you go I'll be there love Cactus Jack. On The September 14th episode of World Championshi Wrestling it was annouced that there would be a mysterious match that involved Sting, Rick Steiner a returning Scott Steiner & El Giante facing Abdullah The Buthcher Oz The Diamond Studd & Barry Windham called a Chamber Of Horrors Match. For Weeks Cactus Jack & Abdullah The Butcher used a Singapore Cain on everybody they could Bill Kazmaier, Bobby Eaton & on The September 28th episode of World Championship Wrestling Cactus Jack gave Rick Steiner  a Double Arm DDT on a big piece of wood. On The October 5th episode of World Championship Wrestling Abdullah The Butcher & Cactus Jack had a cake with a Sting action figure on it & sung happy birthday no I'm not making this up. On The October 19th episode of World Championship Wrestling Sting struck back & took a The Singapore Cain & went after Abdullah The Butcher & Cactus Jack. The WCW World Tag Team Championship was vacated cause of Scott Steiner's injury there was a tournament held that went to The Clash Of Champions 16. It was won by The Enorcers Arn Anderson & Larry Zbyszko. At Clash Of Champions 16 Bill Kazmeier was the Tag Team partner of Rick Steiner he was performing a feat of strength when Arn Anderson & Larry Zbyszko took a weight & hit it on Bill Kazmeier's side which sofened him up for the match which was won by Anderson & Zbyzsko. So they pretty much owned the tag team division. On The October 5th episode of World Championship Wrestling The Freebirds turned face when they challenged The Enforcers for The World Tag Team titles they beat them in a non title match the following week on World Championship Wrestling The Enforcers were set to defend the titles  against The Screaming Eagales which was Hayes & Garvin under masks. The Enforcers retained the titles Anderson hit Hayes in the head with 1 of the belts. Instead of doing The Enforcers vs The Freebirds The Enforcers faced The Patroits Chip & Todd Champion instead at this show. Cause The Patroits were The WCW United States Tag Team Champions they defeated The Freebirds on The September 7th episode of World Championship Wrestling. At The Clash Of Champions 16 they had The Semi Finals for The WCW Lightheavyweight Championship Tournament. Brian Pillman returned to WCW after having to play The Yellow Dog he defeated Bad Street to go on to The Finals at Halloween Havoc & Richard Morton defeated Mike "He broke 6,000 guitars & he never drew a dime" Graham to go on to The Finals. On The September 28th episode of World Championship Wrestling Pillman was set to wrestle Thomas Rich who had joined The York Foundation Richard Morton stepped in he said hey lets do it now while Morton was hurt outside of the ring Thomas Rich came in but he got rolled up. The following week on World Championship Wrestling Thomas Rich & Brian Pillman were wrestling & Rich used The York Foundation computer as a weapon & got the win. Then The followin week on World Championship Wrestling all 3 members of The York Foundation attacked Pillman who had an injured arm. Stunning Steve Austin had became a very good TV Champion & on The August 17th episode of World Championship Wrestling he defended it against Dustin Rhodes which that match ended in disqualification. It was decided on that Dustin Rhodes would get a rematch. Austin had been using knucks that Lady Blossom had been handing to him to cheat Dustin Rhodes kept telling The Referee what was going on but he couldn't do anything cause she hid the knucks in her dress. On The October 19th episode of World Championship Wrestling Madusa debuted & pulled the knucks out of Lady Blossom's Dress. During a woman's match on the following week on World Championship Wrestling she attacked Bambi & Judy Martin after the match she said she is here to be the only woman in WCW. On The October 5th episode of World Championship Wrestling it was announced that a guy by the name of The WCW Halloween Phantom would be there. You should all know who that turned out to be if not you'll know. Now that is the backstory as best I can tell it leading into this event. The Buyrate was a 0.80 that is down from last years Halloween Havoc that got a 1.33DateOctober 27, 1991Attendance8,900VenueUTC ArenaCityChattanooga, TennesseeAt the start of the show they showed where earlier in the day Barry Windham was attacked coming to the arena by Larry Zbyszko & Arn Anderson they slammed the car door on his wrist & hand so he couldn't compete.Chamber Of HorrorsStingEl GianteRick Steiner& Scott SteinerDefAbdullah The ButhcerCactus JackThe Diamond Studd& Vader* for the wrestlecrapBig pop for Vader The Steiner's & a huge pop for Sting. You had these guys dressed in Hostpital Scrubs come down called "Gouls". This match is famous for the wrestlecrap involved Abdullah The Butcher was strapped in The Electric Chair & shocked to h  e  l  l. I can suspend my disbelief believe me I can I'm not 1 of these p  u  s  s  i  e  s that demand realism but Abdullah gets right up from  being shocked in The Electric Chair ok? Abdullah attacked "The Gouls" the fans yelled we want Sting.They go to the back where Eric Bischoff & Missy Hyatt interview The Young Pistols they basically turned heel they want The US Tag titles.Big Josh & PN News Def The Creatures * I'll give it that much The Creatures came out with the music Psychosis would use this match was watchable.Bobby Eaton Def Terrance Taylor with Alexandra York ** & half stars this was a decent matchJohnny B Badd with Theodore Long Def Jimmy "Jam" Garvin with Michael PS Hayes * Hayes & Garvin are very much over with the crowd. Garvin was enteraining but again I don't have the time for a Marc Mero match.Missy Hyatt was looking for The WCW Halloween PhantomWCW Televison ChmapionshipChampion Steve Austin with Lady Blossom vs Dustin Rhodes went to a draw *** this was a good match both men busted each other open a good back & forth.Bill Kazmeier Def Oz DUD bad match You go from Austin vs Rhodes to this.Van Hammer Def Doug Sommers another DUDOMG Van Hammer's enterance had these guys taking Jack Hammer's to the stage. This was a s  h  it match.Then Brian Pillman & Richard Morton cut their promos for their up coming matchFinals for the WCW Lightheavyweight ChmapionshipBrian Pillman Def Richard Morton with Alexandra York **This was Brian Pillaman's 1st single's title & for the life of me I don't know why they cut this from the VHS. The Referee had this camera thing called The Refer Eye Cam I can see why it was dropped The Ref had to wear this stupid hard hat helmet thing.The WCW Halloween Phantom Def The Z Man Tom Zenk DUD but what happens soom is great. Tony Schavonie ruined for The Pay Per View audience probably he said there are few signature moves in the sport 1 is called The Rude Aweakening.WCW World Tag Team ChampionshipChampions The Enforcers Arn Anderson & Larry Zbyszko Def The WCW US Tag Team Champions The Patroits Todd Champion & Firebreaker Chip* & 3 of a quarter stars The Patroits are announced from The WCW Special Forces wtf? The Enforcers made this enjoyable good tag team work they were a good heel tag team. The new WCW World Tag Team Championship belts made there debut at this show replacing the old NWA Tag Team belts.Eric Bischoff interviewed Paul E Dangerously & Madusa. Paul E Dangerously said "There's a story here that no one had the guts to break. For those of you that have been watching TV & haven't seen me for the past couple of weeks. WCW is ran by a streering lead by a  bunch of modern day Einsteins that don't realize that it's 1991. These people think I'm too conterversal & that I'm too outspoken they say to me Paul E Dangerouly you are no longer The Co Host of World Championship Wrestling. Now this means WAR! This means war on The Championship  Committee this means war on WCW! Cause in case you frogot I have a Managers Licence. The only way to bankrupt this whole d  a  m  n company is to take away your heroes! I'm staring right at the top with Sting, So I got Madusa & I said Madusa find me the man that would eliminate Sting dor good! This man is in the building tonight. that man is The WCW Halloween Phantom! The man behind this mask is the only man that can help me bankrupt this whole company. The man behind this mask has elimanted everyone in his way. The Man behind this mask is the only man that can crush the hopes of The Little Stingers. To where he stands over the rements of his career & he says ashes to ashes DUST TO DUST RIP Sting! Ladies & Gentlemen The next WCW United States Champion RICK RUDE!" He unmasked Rick Rude said "What better way to start off with a low life like Sting. I wounder if he is as small as he is on TV I'm going to help Mr Dangerously tear apart The WCW & take The United States title.2 out of 3 falls for theWCW World Heavyweight ChampionshipChampion Lex Luger with Harley Race Def Ron Simmons with Dusty Rhodes ***Mr Hughes was barred from ringsideThe 1st fall went to Ron SimmonsThe 2nd fall went to Luger when Simmons accidently threw Luger over the top ropeLex Luger won the 3rd fall when he hit The Attitude Adjustment his version of the piledriver take that CenaNot a classic 2 out of 3 falls match but it was good.The World title match is good Dustin Rhodes vs Steve Austin for The TV title is a good match Bobby Eaton vs Terrance Taylor is decent the under card is mediocre Brian Pillman defeating Richard Morton to become The 1st WCW Lightheavyweight Champion is an ok bout . The long term booking that set up The Dangerous Alliance was goog as well as Arn Anderson & Larry Zbyszko crushing Barry Windham's hand set up The Dangerous Alliance even more.I don't know though if you should check it out cause cause if you don't like wrestlecrap then no but there is some good wrestling on it. Next I'll take a look at Starrcade 1991 Battlebowl.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Chamber of Horrors match was a dud and a Big Lipped Alligator Moment to boot. Who thought of this? Dr.Insano? The Johnny B. Badd-Jimmy Garvin match was watchable but nothing special. The TV Title match between "Stunning" Steve Austin & Dustin Rhodes was not great but pretty good. The Tom Zenk-The WCW Phantom(Rick Rude) match was short but not sweet. The World Tag Team title match between The Enforcers(Arn Anderson & Larry Zbyszko) & The Patriots(Todd Champion & Firecracker Chip) was decent at best. The 2 out of 3 falls match for the World title between Lex Luger & Ron Simmons was also not great but pretty good. I give this PPV a 5 out of 10.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Event: WCW Halloween Havoc 1991: "Chamber of Horrors"Date: October 27, 1991Location: Chattanooga, TennesseeArena: UTC ArenaAttendence: 8,900Chamber of Horrors Match: El Gigante, Sting, Rick and Scott Steiner defeated Abdullah the Butcher, The Diamond Stud, Cactus Jack, and Big Van Vader (12:33) in a "chamber of horrors" match when Abdullah was put in the electric chair....***Big Josh and PN News defeated The Creatures (Joey Maggs and Johnny Rich) (5:16) when News made the pin....*Bobby Eaton pinned Terrance Taylor (16:00)....***Johnny B Badd pinned Jimmy Garvin (8:16)....**World Television Title Match: Steve Austin drew with Dustin Rhodes (15:00). Steve Austin retains the title....****Bill Kazmeier defeated Oz (3:59) via submission....*Van Hammer pinned Doug Sommers (1:13)....*World Light Heavyweight Title Match: Brian Pillman pinned Richard Morton (12:45) to win the title....***The Halloween Phantom (Rude) pinned Tom Zenk (1:27)....*World Tag Team Title Match: The Enforcers (Arn Anderson and Larry Zbysko) defeated The WCW Patriots (Todd Champion aand Firebreaker Chip) (9:51) when Anderson pinned Chip to retain the titles....***World Heavyweight Title Match (Best Out of 3 Falls Match): Lex Luger defeated Ron Simmons (18:59) in three falls to retain the title. Simmons pinned Luger (4:54). Simmons was Disqualified (15:00). Luger pinned Simmons (18:59).*****
Title: N/A
